header: Russia Pounds Ukraine With ‘One of the Largest Strikes’ of the War
desc: President Volodymyr Zelensky condemned an assault of more than 200 missiles and drones that ranged from Kyiv to Odesa to Ukraine’s West. Energy infrastructure was again a target.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Matthew Mpoke Bigg

header: Why Hasn’t Russia Kicked Out Ukrainian Invaders? Its Own Invaders Are Busy.
desc: Despite its overwhelming firepower, Russia has been unable for weeks to push Ukrainian troops back across the border, with the failure as much the result of priorities as a lack of personnel.
author: Lara Jakes and Eric Schmitt

header: In Eastern Ukraine, Terrifying Bombardment and Near Total Destruction
desc: Powerful guided “glide bombs” have helped Russia raze entire towns with ever greater speed. “When you drive into a ruined town, it’s like hopelessness,” one soldier said.
author: Marc Santora and Tyler Hicks

header: Telegram Turmoil Threatens Dominant Chronicle of the War in Ukraine
desc: The detention of Telegram’s founder has highlighted the messaging app’s outsize status in Europe’s deadliest war since World War II.
author: Anatoly Kurmanaev

header: Russia Strikes Ukrainian Cities With Missiles and Drones
desc: Cities across Ukraine were hit in a widespread attack that also targeted energy infrastructure, Ukrainian officials said.
author: Reuters

header: Russia Launches Deadly New Wave of Missiles and Drones at Ukraine
desc: The bombardment that began on Monday could have additional significance, coming three weeks after the Ukrainian military’s incursion into Russia’s Kursk region.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Matthew Mpoke Bigg

header: A Fatal Knife Attack Puts an Immigration Spotlight on a German City
desc: After the fatal stabbing, which prosecutors say was committed by a Syrian who was rejected for asylum, the city of Solingen finds itself at the center of a longstanding debate over migrants.
author: Christopher F. Schuetze

header: Top Biden Aide Visits China to Reinforce U.S. Strategy
desc: The national security adviser, Jake Sullivan, will raise thorny issues like Taiwan and Russia with only months left before a new administration takes office.
author: David Pierson

header: Ukraine Says It Struck at 2 Oil Depots Inside Russia
desc: Kyiv is pressing its drone campaign while lobbying allies for permission to use weapons supplied by NATO countries for strikes deep inside Russia.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg

header: F-16 Fighter Jet, Recently Supplied to Ukraine, Crashes
desc: A Western official said the advanced fighter crashed while defending against a Russian aerial assault. It was not clear how it was destroyed, but the loss is a blow to Ukraine, given the planes’ prominence.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Eric Schmitt

header: Shelling Kills 6 in Ukraine as Russia Pushes Ahead in East
desc: The rest of the country, though, was largely spared from another consecutive night of large-scale Russian bombardment.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg

header: The Woman Shaking Up German Politics From the East
desc: Sahra Wagenknecht, a former Communist, has founded her own party to respond to German grievances about migrants, crime and the dangers of the war in Ukraine.
author: Steven Erlanger

header: The East Rises in Germany, and So Does Political Extremism
desc: Closely watched elections in the former East Germany are likely to reveal a still-divided country and yield a worrying challenge to Berlin.
author: Steven Erlanger

header: U.K.’s Starmer Wants to ‘Turn a Corner on Brexit.’ What Does That Mean?
desc: On a trip to Germany, Prime Minister Keir Starmer exchanged warm words with Germany’s chancellor, Olaf Scholz. But a reset with the European Union will depend on actions too.
author: Stephen Castle

header: Top Biden Aide Holds Rare Talks With Chinese Military General
desc: Jake Sullivan also met with China’s top leader, Xi Jinping, who said the United States should “find a correct way for the two major countries to get along.”
author: Keith Bradsher and David Pierson

header: Russia’s Youngest Conscripts Unexpectedly See Combat Against Ukraine’s Invasion
desc: The long-sacrosanct practice of keeping young Russian army conscripts off the front lines is eroding as the lack of troops in Russia’s Kursk region indicates a manpower shortage.
author: Neil MacFarquhar and Milana Mazaeva

header: As Ukraine Mourns a Pilot’s Death, Jet’s Crash Is Still a Mystery
desc: In a reversal, two senior U.S. military officials say the cause of the F-16’s crash was probably not friendly fire.
author: Marc Santora

header: They Traveled Home After Defending Ukraine, and Ended Up in a Russian Prison
desc: Two Colombian soldiers who had fought for Ukraine are now under arrest in Moscow. They wound up there after stopping over in Venezuela, which apparently extradited them.
author: Anatoly Kurmanaev, Simón Posada and Oleg Matsnev

header: Zelensky Dismisses the Head of the Air Force Days After F-16 Crash
desc: The Ukrainian president gave no reason, but there are indications that friendly fire may have brought down the jet, a Western official said.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Eric Schmitt

header: Putin Plans First Visit to I.C.C. Member State Since Arrest Warrant
desc: The Russian president will travel to Mongolia, a member of the International Criminal Court, which issued a warrant for his arrest in 2023.
author: Eve Sampson

header: Inmate Revolts Highlight Failings and Miseries of Russian Prisons
desc: Staff shortages, beatings, corruption and harsh treatment of Muslim prisoners have all led to unrest among inmates, with recent uprisings turning deadly.
author: Valerie Hopkins and Ekaterina Bodyagina

header: What to Watch For in East German State Elections on Sunday
desc: The prospect of a strong performance by the far-right Alternative for Germany party in two state elections is only one of the problems for Chancellor Olaf Scholz.
author: Christopher F. Schuetze

header: Eiffel Tower Will Keep Olympic Rings Permanently, Mayor Says
desc: “I want the two to remain married,” Mayor Anne Hidalgo of Paris said in a newspaper interview.
author: Aurelien Breeden

header: The Angry East
desc: As east Germans vote, a region in decline is searching for answers on the political extremes.
author: Ingmar Nolting and Christopher F. Schuetze

header: Russia Hits Ukraine With Wave of Strikes as School Year Opens
desc: The attack, the third large-scale bombardment in a week, coincided with intense fighting in eastern Ukraine and Russia.
author: Andrew E. Kramer

header: With Russia on Its Doorstep, a Ukrainian Town Packs Its Bags
desc: Ukraine gambled that its move into Russia would draw Moscow’s forces away from the town of Pokrovsk. It didn’t happen. And now resigned residents are evacuating daily.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Nicole Tung

header: Russians Bomb Kharkiv, Ukraine Says, After Russia Reports Wave of Attacks
desc: Ukraine said Russia struck the country’s second-largest city with missiles and bombs. Russian state media and local officials earlier reported that Ukraine attacked power plants and refineries with drones.
author: Marc Santora and David Guttenfelder

header: In a Kyiv Classroom, Cries for Help From Children Scarred by War
desc: “They are like a bleeding wound, and no one sees it,” a schoolteacher said of her pupils, many of whom have fled frontline areas or lost family members in the fighting.
author: Oleksandr Chubko and Carlotta Gall

header: Putin Begins Meetings in Mongolia in Defiance of I.C.C. Arrest Warrant
desc: The Russian president is making a state visit to a country that is heavily dependent on Moscow for oil.
author: Valerie Hopkins and David Pierson

header: Takeaways From East Germany’s State Elections
desc: The far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, had a very successful night in two states, despite its state chapters’ classification as “extremist” by German domestic intelligence.
author: Christopher F. Schuetze

header: East Germans Lean Toward Extremes in State Elections
desc: The Alternative for Germany party was on course to win in Thuringia, according to projections, in what was seen as a worrying sign of the health of German democracy.
author: Steven Erlanger and Christopher F. Schuetze

header: A U.K. Succession Drama: Who Will Be the Next Ambassador to the U.S.?
desc: Diplomat Karen Pierce has built alliances with Trump officials and the Biden-Harris administration. But with her term set to end next year, the U.K. government has a dilemma over her replacement.
author: Mark Landler

header: Even Summer Nights Can’t Escape Egypt’s Economic Crisis
desc: It’s so hot in Cairo that people like to go out all night. It might look like a party, but in reality, one shopkeeper said, “everybody is dead on the inside.”
author: Vivian Yee and Hadeer Mahmoud Ahmed

header: No Time to Run: Russian Missiles Hit Ukraine City Just After Sirens Sound
desc: More than 50 people were killed by two high-speed missiles that hit a military academy in the eastern city of Poltava, one of the most lethal Russian strikes in the war.
author: David Guttenfelder, Yurii Shyvala, Maria Varenikova and Marc Santora

header: A Timeline of Some of the Deadliest Attacks in Ukraine’s War With Russia
desc: At least 11,520 civilians had been killed in the war, according to a United Nations report in July, which said the true tally may be higher.
author: Eve Sampson

header: Missile and Drone Attacks Across Ukraine Kill at Least 7 in Lviv
desc: Russia attacked a number of cities a day after a devastating strike in the country’s east, Ukrainian officials said.
author: Victoria Kim and Qasim Nauman

header: Russia’s Attack on Poltava Comes After a Week of Strikes in Ukraine
desc: Moscow appears to have stepped up the tempo of its attacks, resulting in a wave of death and destruction in Ukraine.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg

header: Ukraine’s Top Diplomat Has Become a Familiar Face, Rallying Wartime Support
desc: Dmytro Kuleba has lobbied Kyiv’s allies to supply missile defense systems. He was among several Ukrainian ministers who offered to resign on Wednesday, an official said.
author: Lynsey Chutel

header: Aftermath of Military Academy Strike Drains Ukraine’s Seasoned Rescuers
desc: Repeated air-raid alerts have punctuated the search through the rubble in Poltava, in eastern Ukraine, after an attack that killed more than 50 people.
author: Andrew E. Kramer

header: Ukraine Electric Company Boss Fired as Russia Pounds Power Grid
desc: The head of Ukrenergo was reportedly blamed for failing to fortify energy infrastructure, which has come under steady Russian bombardment, leading to blackouts.
author: Maria Varenikova

header: Ukraine’s foreign minister offers to resign as Zelensky plans major shake-up.
desc: President Volodymyr Zelensky is expected to make the broadest changes to his government since Russia invaded more than two years ago.
author: Marc Santora

header: Ukraine Names Candidates for Its New Cabinet in Major Overhaul
desc: President Volodymyr Zelensky said that he was acting to bring a “new energy” to state institutions at an important diplomatic juncture.
author: Marc Santora and Maria Varenikova

header: Short Notice and Blocked Exits Proved Lethal in Strike in Ukraine
desc: When two Russian ballistic missiles struck a military academy in Poltava, debris blocked corridors and exits. Cadets near a bomb shelter survived. Others did not.
author: Andrew E. Kramer, Maria Varenikova and David Guttenfelder

header: Putin Drives Home a Perilous Point: Ukraine’s East Is Russia’s Main Goal
desc: Dismissing Ukraine’s recent invasion of Kursk, the Russian leader said Kyiv made a mistake in trying to force Moscow to divert its forces from the Donbas region.
author: Marc Santora, Anton Troianovski and Nicole Tung

header: Meeting With Allies, Zelensky Presses for More Weapons
desc: The Ukrainian leader argued that escalating military pressure on Russia, combined with diplomacy, was the best way to motivate Moscow to seek peace.
author: Andrew E. Kramer

header: Distracted and Divided, Russian Security Service Misses Threats
desc: The Ukrainian offensive over the border caught Moscow’s intelligence agencies by surprise, experts say. It wasn’t the first time that has happened during the war.
author: Michael Schwirtz

header: Ukrainian Forces Block Russian Advance on a Key Eastern Town
desc: Russia’s drive toward Pokrovsk has stalled along one part of the frontline, but its troops continue to advance in other parts of eastern Ukraine, and its long-range aerial attacks continue.
author: Andrew E. Kramer

header: Street Artist Documents War in Ukraine, One Stark Mural at a Time
desc: Using ruins as his canvas, Gamlet Zinkivskyi has captured life in wartime Ukraine in dozens of grim, gripping and harshly beautiful paintings. “Broken, but invincible,” read one captioned work.

header: Spy Chiefs of the C.I.A. and MI6 Convene, on a Couch and for a Crowd
desc: Appearing together publicly for the first time in the history of their agencies, the heads of the U.S. and British intelligence services discussed Ukraine’s incursion into Russia and the war in Gaza.

header: Iran Sent Short-Range Missiles to Russia, Western Officials Say
desc: U.S. and European countries had warned of sanctions if Iran provided weapons that could be used against Ukraine. President Biden’s lame-duck status could hamper a response.
author: Steven Erlanger, Julian E. Barnes and Michael Crowley

header: Fugitive Televangelist Wanted by F.B.I. Is Caught in the Philippines
desc: Weeks of tense standoff in the Philippines have ended in the capture of a pastor accused of leading an international ring of sex abuse and trafficking of young women and girls.
author: Hannah Beech and Jes Aznar

header: Russian Forces Capture 2 Villages in Eastern Ukraine, Analysis Shows
desc: Russia appears to be trying to cut off Ukrainian soldiers around the strategic city of Pokrovsk, a focal point of the war in recent months.
author: Maria Varenikova and Matthew Mpoke Bigg

header: How Russia’s Steady Advance Threatens Ukraine’s East
desc: Russia is getting closer to cutting critical supply lines for troops in the remaining Ukrainian strongholds across the region.
author: Josh Holder and Andrew E. Kramer

header: Ukraine Fires Deadly Drone Barrage at Russia, Taking War Closer to Moscow
desc: A woman in the capital region was killed during the attack, officials said. Russian air defenses shot down 20 drones around Moscow and almost 150 nationwide, according to the Defense Ministry.
author: Andrew E. Kramer and Ivan Nechepurenko

header: The Bomb Shelters Are Busy. So Are the Nail Salons.
desc: In Ukraine, even a visit for a manicure, which often involves navigating power outages and air-raid sirens, can turn into an act of defiance.
author: Kim Barker

header: Ukrainian Drone Attack Hits Apartment Buildings Near Moscow
desc: One woman was killed in the Moscow suburb of Ramenskoye after Ukraine launched one of its largest drone attacks of the war, Kremlin officials said.
author: Christina Kelso

header: U.S., Imposing Sanctions, Accuses Iran of Sending Missiles to Russia
desc: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken spoke in London, where his British counterpart also promised a punitive response. They plan to visit Ukraine together.
author: Edward Wong

header: A Tug Between Russia and Europe Divides a Tiny Balkan Nation
desc: A falling-out between former political allies in Montenegro has complicated the country’s efforts to join the European Union and curb pro-Russian influence.
author: Andrew Higgins

header: How a Philippine Televangelist Ended Up on the F.B.I.’s Most-Wanted List
desc: Here is what to know about the powerful doomsday preacher Apollo Carreon Quiboloy and his arrest.
author: Eve Sampson

header: Russian Forces Are Stepping Up Attacks on Strategic City, Ukraine Says
desc: Bombardments are increasing in and around Pokrovsk in eastern Ukraine, with water supplies now cut, while Russian troops simultaneously press a new counterattack in the Kursk region.
author: Andrew E. Kramer

header: 3 Red Cross Workers Killed in Ukraine by Shelling
desc: The aid workers lost their lives as they were preparing to distribute heating supplies in preparation for winter in the region of Donetsk.
author: Eve Sampson

header: In Kyiv, Blinken Discusses Ukraine’s Push for Deep Missile Strikes into Russia
desc: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken and his British counterpart, David Lammy, made a rare joint trip to Ukraine to show allied solidarity as the American presidential election looms.
author: Edward Wong

header: Should Ukraine Launch Western Weapons Deep Into Russia?
desc: President Biden has refused to allow Ukraine to use long-range Western missiles on Russian military targets, but he appears to be wavering.
author: Lara Jakes

header: Ukraine Says Russian Missile Hit Grain Ship in Black Sea
desc: If confirmed, the attack would be the first on a commercial vessel in open waters since the 2022 invasion, and a sharp escalation of hostilities in the Black Sea.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg, Andrew E. Kramer and Maria Varenikova

header: United States Backs Africa’s U.N. Security Council Bid, With a Catch
desc: The announcement provides U.S. support to permanent council seats for African nations, though not new veto powers. But the path to adding members requires far more than White House approval.
author: Lynsey Chutel and Farnaz Fassihi

header: After Being Shot, Slovakia’s Leader Targets His Enemies
desc: Prime Minister Robert Fico has purged prosecutors, cultural officials, journalists and others he believes fueled “hatred and aggression” against him.
author: Andrew Higgins

header: Ukrainian Troops Talk of Stiffer Resistance as They Fight in Russian Territory
desc: Soldiers and military analysts say that Ukraine is largely holding onto land it seized in the Kursk region, even as Moscow has begun a counterattack.
author: Marc Santora and David Guttenfelder

header: Diplomacy Over Ukraine War Is About Weapons More Than Peace Talks
desc: For both Ukraine and Russia, battlefield gains now might provide an upper hand in any negotiations later. That’s reflected in their discussions over arms with allies.

header: Read Putin’s Warning to NATO on Ukraine’s Use of Long-Range Weapons
desc: The Russian president said Western support for Ukrainian strikes deep inside Russia would put his country and NATO “at war.”
author: NA

header: The Long-Range Weapons Ukraine Wants to Use on Russia, Explained
desc: The United States and its allies are once again considering expanding the capabilities they provide to Ukraine in its fight against Russia’s invasion.
author: Eve Sampson and Lara Jakes

header: Toronto Film Festival Pulls Documentary on Russian Soldiers
desc: The festival canceled the screenings of “Russians at War,” which has been criticized as Kremlin propaganda. The filmmaker has said it is an antiwar film.
author: Qasim Nauman

header: Putin Has Issued Many Warnings to the West. Is This One Different?
desc: Vladimir Putin said allowing Ukraine to use long-range Western weapons would mean NATO countries were “at war with Russia.” It was one of his most direct threats yet.

header: Biden Hasn’t Let Kyiv Strike Deep Into Russia. Could Britain Change That?
desc: A trip to Washington by Britain’s prime minister, Keir Starmer, came after President Vladimir Putin of Russia warned that the allies’ next step could mean war for NATO.

header: Churchill, Abducted From Canada, Is Found Glowering in Italy
desc: The theft of an iconic Churchill portrait by Yousuf Karsh went unnoticed for months. But two years later, the police have tracked down the photograph.

header: Going the Distance at the Tram Driver Olympics

author: Amelia Nierenberg

header: North Korea Gives First Glimpse of Weapons-Grade Uranium Factory
desc: Its leader, Kim Jong-un, visited the factory and urged his country to produce more highly enriched uranium to build “exponentially” more nuclear weapons.

header: Despite Relentless Russian Attack, Life in Kharkiv Endures Underground
desc: Kharkiv, Ukraine, has adjusted to life amid the threat of bombings. Its resilience is manifested in a curious blend of life above and below ground.

header: Russia Ramps Up Air Assault on Ukrainian Cities

header: In Georgia, a Political Uproar Erupts Over a 2008 War With Russia

header: A Top E.U. Commissioner Resigns, Citing ‘Questionable Governance’

header: Israeli Defense Minister Tells U.S. Military Action Against Hezbollah Is Needed
desc: Meeting with a senior Biden administration adviser, Defense Minister Yoav Gallant said “the only way” for Israel to return its displaced citizens to the northern border is through military action against Hezbollah.

header: Russia Seizes Eastern Town as Ukraine Hits Big Ammunition Depot
desc: The capture of Ukrainsk underscored Russia’s steady advances in the Donetsk region. Ukraine is trying to counter with strikes on Russian military infrastructure.

header: Ukraine-Russia War Updates: Moscow Hits Back in Kursk as Air War Heats Up
desc: Moscow’s troops have retaken a few villages in a border area that Kyiv’s forces invaded last month and are also advancing steadily in eastern Ukraine.

header: He Had 5 Followers on YouTube. It Landed Him in Jail, Where He Died.
desc: Among the hundreds of Russians jailed for criticizing the war in Ukraine, the death of Pavel Kushnir in detention has transformed him into an antiwar symbol.
author: Neil MacFarquhar and Milana Mazaeva

header: Right Sector (Ukraine)
desc: News about Right Sector (Ukraine). Commentary and archival information about Right Sector (Ukraine) from The New York Times.
author: NA

header: Naftogaz of Ukraine
desc: News about Naftogaz of Ukraine. Commentary and archival information about Naftogaz of Ukraine from The New York Times.
author: NA

header: Ukraine International Airlines
desc: News about Ukraine International Airlines. Commentary and archival information about Ukraine International Airlines from The New York Times.
author: NA

header: Top Jobs in Brussels Reflect New Political Realities for Europe
desc: Ursula von der Leyen named her choices for the European Commission as she navigates a host of challenges, including the rise of nationalist forces.
author: Jenny Gross and Emma Bubola

header: An Al Qaeda Affiliate Claimed Attacks in Mali. What Does It Want?
desc: An extremist group that claims allegiance to Al Qaeda said it was responsible for assaults on a military police school and an air base in the West African country of Mali.
author: Elian Peltier and Ruth Maclean

header: Explosions Rock Russian Munitions Depot as Ukraine Attempts to Disrupt War
desc: NA
author: Christoph Koettl and Haley Willis

header: Ukraine Says Russia Hit Nursing Home Near Border, Killing at Least 1
desc: A dozen other people were injured, some seriously, in the attack in the city of Sumy, which has come under increased bombardment since Ukraine’s offensive into Russia’s nearby Kursk region.

header: Their Countries Are at War. These Couples Are Still Together.

author: Laura Boushnak, Alan Yuhas and Oleksandra Mykolyshyn

header: Europe’s New Defense Chief: ‘A King Without a Kingdom’?
desc: The European Union has vowed to enhance its military capability. But money is scarce, responsibilities overlap and the new job is less about soldiers than arms manufacturers.
author: Steven Erlanger and Jenny Gross

header: Britain’s Hard-Right Firebrand Has Big Plans for His Anti-Immigration Party
desc: Nigel Farage, a Trump ally and Brexit champion, thinks Reform U.K. can become a major political force. At a conference on Friday, he sought to explain how.
author: Stephen Castle

header: U.N. Meets Amid a Backdrop of Growing Chaos and Violence
desc: Beginning Tuesday, world leaders will discuss three wars, climate change, rising sea levels and proposals to expand representation on the Security Council.
author: Farnaz Fassihi

header: Ukraine Hits 2 More Russian Munition Depots, Aiming to Disrupt War Effort
desc: Strikes on weapons arsenals are crucial to weaken Moscow’s overwhelming superiority in battlefield firepower, analysts said.
author: Constant Méheut

header: The German Chancellor’s Party Ekes Out a Win Over the Far Right
desc: The narrow win by Olaf Scholz’s party came in a state election, the third in a series that was seen as a reflection of the national mood and a snapshot of the government’s popularity.

header: How the Kremlin Finds Ways to Spread Its Messages
desc: Social media companies may try to ban RT, the Russian state media broadcaster. But the network has proved in the past to be a wily adversary when confronted with efforts to silence it.

header: What to Watch For in a Key German State Election
desc: The far right and far left are poised to make significant gains in state voting on Sunday, possibly affecting the stability of the national government in Berlin.

header: Israel and Hezbollah Threaten to Hit Harder, Raising Fears of All-Out War
desc: A leader of the Iranian-backed militia said its latest barrage was “just the beginning,” and an Israeli military official said, “Our strikes will intensify.”
author: Adam Rasgon, Euan Ward, Hwaida Saad and Ken Belson

header: How a U.S. Ally Uses Aid as a Cover in War
desc: The United Arab Emirates is expanding a covert campaign to back a winner in Sudan’s civil war. Waving the banner of the Red Crescent, it is also smuggling weapons and deploying drones.

header: Ukrainian Poet and Rock Star Fights Near Front and Performs Behind It
desc: Serhiy Zhadan, 50, is a beloved Ukrainian poet as well as a novelist, lyricist and rock star. Furious over the invasion, he enlisted to fight even as his band still plays and his readings fill halls.

header: Zelensky Addresses the Security Council, Calling for Attention to Stay on Ukraine
desc: “Russia can only be forced into peace.” President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine urged the Council members to sustain their backing for his country’s resistance to Russia’s full-scale invasion.

header: As U.N. Meets, Pressure Mounts on Biden to Loosen Up on Arms for Ukraine
desc: Finland’s president and NATO’s departing secretary general are urging Mr. Biden to allow Ukraine to use weapons to hit bases deeper inside Russia.

header: Ukraine Needs to Be Realistic About Its Goals, Czech President Says

header: Zelensky Prepares for Tough Act Putting Ukraine War Back on Global Agenda

header: Here is the latest on the U.N. meeting.
desc: The wars in Gaza, Ukraine and Sudan are expected to dominate
author: Farnaz Fassihi, Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Zolan Kanno-Youngs

header: Russia’s Next-Generation Nuclear Missile Failed a Test, Evidence Suggests
desc: Satellite photos showing a 200-foot-wide crater at a launch site indicate that the Sarmat missile, said by the Kremlin to travel at five times the speed of sound, might not be ready for duty.

header: Iran will aim to both defuse tensions with the West and criticize Israel at the assembly, officials say.
desc: NA
author: Farnaz Fassihi

header: In his first U.N. speech, Iran’s president aimed to defuse tensions with the West while criticizing Israel.
desc: NA
author: Farnaz Fassihi

header: Guterres warns that a ‘powder keg risks engulfing the world’ as he urges world leaders to take action.
desc: NA
author: Farnaz Fassihi

desc: With fall approaching, Ukraine says its forces in the eastern Donetsk region are facing battle more frequently than they have in months.
author: Marc Santora and Nicole Tung

header: What Is Zelensky’s ‘Victory Plan’ for Ukraine’s War With Russia?
desc: The Ukrainian leader aims to present President Biden with a strategy to improve his country’s position ahead of any peace negotiations with Russia.

header: U.S. House Speaker Demands That Ukraine Fire Ambassador
desc: The public call from Speaker Mike Johnson deals a blow to Kyiv’s efforts to avoid the partisan acrimony of the U.S. presidential campaign.

header: For the second time in two weeks, U.K.’s Starmer will discuss the Ukraine weapons dilemma.
desc: On the agenda for Prime Minister Keir Starmer in New York: private talks with the U.S. over whether to allow Ukraine to use long range weapons in Russia, and Middle East tensions.

desc: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine told the meeting of world leaders that capitulating to Russia would only give its president, Vladimir Putin, the “political space to continue the war.”

header: The long-range weapons Ukraine wants to use on Russia, explained.
desc: The United States and its allies are once again considering expanding the capabilities they provide to Ukraine in its fight against Russia’s invasion.
author: Eve Sampson and Lara Jakes

header: Biden and allies create a Marshall Plan-style initiative to rebuild Ukraine using frozen Russian assets.
desc: NA
author: Sheryl Gay Stolberg

header: Ukrainian troops continue to lose ground to Russia as Zelensky tries to rally allies at the Assembly.
desc: NA
author: Constant Méheut

header: Putin Declares Changes to Russian Nuclear Doctrine
desc: President Vladimir V. Putin heightened his warnings against the West, asserting that Russia should be permitted to use nuclear arms in the event of an attack by a nation backed by a nuclear power.

header: Here is the latest on the U.N. meeting.
desc: NA
author: Farnaz Fassihi, Alan Yuhas and Ivan Nechepurenko

header: Zelensky Meets Trump Amid Fears for Continued U.S. Support for Ukraine
desc: The session in New York was part of a nearly weeklong U.S. visit by the Ukrainian president in which he has made appeals to both Democrats and Republicans.
author: Constant Méheut

header: On Trip to U.S., Zelensky Finds Ukraine’s Fortunes Tied to the Election
desc: A whirlwind week of top-level meetings failed to alleviate concerns in Kyiv that a Trump presidency could lead to a dramatic shift in American policy.
author: Marc Santora

header: As Austrians Vote, Far Right Awaits Its Biggest Success
desc: The Freedom Party has made itself the country’s most popular party, with calls to bar asylum seekers. It is poised to come out on top in parliamentary elections for the first time.

desc: NA

desc: NA
author: Steven Erlanger and Anton Troianovski

header: Here is what to know about Nihon Hidankyo.
desc: NA

author: Jim Tankersley, Christopher F. Schuetze and Anatoly Kurmanaev

header: <U+200B>Kim Jong-un’s Lesson From Ukraine War: Make More Drones

desc: The tech billionaire, a top adviser to President-elect Donald J. Trump, was reported to have discussed ways to defuse tensions between Iran and the United States.

author: Natasha Frost

header: An I.C.C. arrest warrant limits Putin’s movements. This is how he handles it.
desc: NA

header: Russia, an Assad ally, is unlikely to come to his aid.
desc: NA

desc: NA

header: An embattled Macron gets a needed public triumph.
desc: NA
author: Adam Nossiter, Aurelien Breeden and Richard Fausset
